summary: Replaces the eye textures of humans, Altmers, Bosmers, and Dunmers.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#9fc5e8][font=Verdana][size=5]My Skyrim mods are no longer supported.[/size]

[/font][size=4][font=Verdana]I haven't even started the game up for over a year, and I don't really remember much specific to modding it. It's still fine to use, being a simple replacer and all, butÂ chances are that if you've got a problem, I can't really help you.[/font]
[/size][/color]

------------
Description
------------

The eye extures for Skyrim are bad, there's no way getting around that one. Admittedly they look fine in game, but after looking at the textures theselves I knew I'd have to do something about it. Most of the textures already available I didn't care for, so I ended up making some of my own.

These textures only replace the eyes of humans and elves (excluding orcs). My replacements are 512x512. I did attempt the beast races and Orcs, but I didn't produce anything I'd use myself, much less release for others to play with.

For the textures I didn't replace, I suggest you use High Quality Eyes by Xenius. Easiest way to install both is to install that first, then install mine and replace files when asked. I've run into no problems this way.

There are two files available for download, one of them contains uncompressed textures and the other contains compressed textures. The uncompressed textures are better quality, but the compressed textures are much smaller and the quality loss is minimal.


---------------
Modified Files
---------------
